channel.title: Sprites on my client
channel.description:
OK I've started to edit some sprites on my client and they've came out pretty cool but I'm having trouble with some things.. Pictures are all the same size! for the "COMPASS 0" I've used new RS2 compass ..and yes I've saved it as the right file .jag (but these pics I am listing below as the preview are saved as .jpeg) [b]preview:[/b] [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/COMPASS0.jpg[/img] "BACKVMID1 0" [b]preview:[/b] [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/BACKVMID10.jpg[/img] "BACKRIGHT1 0" [b]preview:[/b] [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/BACKRIGHT10.jpg[/img] "MAPBACK 0" [b]preview:[/b] [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/MAPBACK0.jpg[/img]
[b]EDIT:[/b] and when I put them in my [code]C:\Users\My Name\Desktop\MupeScape Client ®\Sprites[/code] and I save them and compile it (not sure if I suppost to compile for pictures.) it comes out like this.. [b]preview:[/b] [IMG]http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x303/mystickid2k6/MSclient.jpg[/img] Why does it come out so stupid like this????? :confused:

item.title: Sprites on my client
item.dc:creator: @nuffenburger nuffenburger
item.description:
@nuffenburger wrote:

you have set your class 30_sub2_sub1_sub1 to have mapback enabled?
hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: Sprites on my client
item.dc:creator: @Mupescape Mupescape
item.description:
@Mupescape wrote:

OK I’ve started to edit some sprites on my client and they’ve came out pretty cool but I’m having trouble with some things…
Pictures are all the same size!
for the “COMPASS 0” I’ve used new RS2 compass
…and yes I’ve saved it as the right file .jag (but these pics I am listing below as the preview are saved as .jpeg)
preview:

it comes out like this…

Why does it come out so stupid like this???
